title: How to Draw an Impossible Triangle

steps.title: Sketch an inverted equilateral triangle.
steps.content: Sketch an inverted equilateral triangle . This will be the center of your triangle.

steps.title: Lightly sketch two parallel lines outside one side of the triangle.
steps.content: Lightly sketch two parallel lines outside one side of the triangle. The lines should be equally spaced. Take caution that your lines are drawn straight.

steps.title: Repeat this for each of the other two sides.
steps.content: Repeat this for each of the other two sides. Your sketch should look like three triangles nested together.

steps.title: Choose one side of the "center" triangle.
steps.content: Choose one side of the "center" triangle. Extend one end of that straight line until it reaches the "middle" triangle.

steps.title: Find the same side of the "middle" triangle.
steps.content: Find the same side of the "middle" triangle. Extend one end of that straight line, in the same direction as before, until it reaches the "outside" triangle.

steps.title: Repeat steps for the other two sides of the triangle.
steps.content: Repeat steps for the other two sides of the triangle.

steps.title: Erase short segments so that the triangle begins to look three-dimensional rather than flat.
steps.content: Erase short segments so that the triangle begins to look three-dimensional rather than flat. Each edge of this "3-D" shape should look like a reverse "L".

steps.title: Add short segments at an angle in the corners.
steps.content: Add short segments at an angle in the corners. These short segments will finish off the outside points.

steps.title: Cleanup your drawing by erasing the points outside of the short segments drawn in the previous step.
steps.content: Cleanup your drawing by erasing the points outside of the short segments drawn in the previous step.

steps.title: Add shading if desired.
steps.content: Add shading if desired.

steps.title: Draw a triangle and extend the ends of the lines past where they join.
steps.content: Draw a triangle and extend the ends of the lines past where they join.

steps.title: Draw lines from these tips, extending them beyond the corners of the inner triangle.
steps.content: Draw lines from these tips, extending them beyond the corners of the inner triangle.

steps.title: Draw in the 'corners'.
steps.content: Draw in the 'corners'.

steps.title: Draw in the final long lines to connect the corners.
steps.content: Draw in the final long lines to connect the corners.

steps.title: Finished.
steps.content: Finished.

steps.title: Draw a hexagon.
steps.content: Draw a hexagon. Three sides should be long and three short, alternating short and long sides. This can easily be done by constructing an equilateral triangle and "chopping" off the corners.

steps.title: Put a smaller, equilateral triangle in the middle of the hexagon.
steps.content: Put a smaller, equilateral triangle in the middle of the hexagon.

steps.title: Draw a line from a corner of the triangle to a corner of the hexagon, as seen in the above picture.
steps.content: Draw a line from a corner of the triangle to a corner of the hexagon, as seen in the above picture.

steps.title: Repeat this process for the other two sides.
steps.content: Repeat this process for the other two sides.

steps.title: Finished.
steps.content: Finished. Shade or colour if desired.
